products.product_desc:
Get your child to start their first coding adventure!

Classes are held Tuesday – Friday 10am to 4pm during half term holiday and Monday – Thursday from 10am to 4pm during summer holidays.

Course Description
Here we introduce your child to logical reasoning and coding concepts. We get them familiar with laptops, the mouse and touch devices such as the iPad. We introduce Mini Coders to the basic idea of robotics, getting them to make basic circuits and use motors with Lego Wedo.

Basic ICT skills and introductory computing concepts are an important first step for children to be able to grasps the concepts which will be taught in school with the new National Computing Curriculum.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you through Class Dojo and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics Covered
– Letter recognition on the keyboard
– Left and right mouse clicks
– Logic games
– What does a computer do
– How does code work
– How does a robot work
– Intro to algorithms, variables and loops
– Intro to Scratch
– What is electricity?
– How does a circuit work?

Pre-requisites
This is an introductory course and students do not need any previous experience with coding. Some activities do require a basic level of reading and writing and this course would be most suited to children who have already started reception. 

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack during the morning.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day! 9am start for everyone the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Book before 15th May for an Early Bird special price!

 

DifficultyBeginner
Age GroupAges 5 to 6
DateMay 30 - June 2, July 17 - 20, July 24 - 27 and July 31 - August 3
LocationColville Primary School, W11 2DF
TimesMonday - Thursday (10am to 4pm) (Tuesday - Friday during half term holiday)
Price£362.50 + VAT (Early Bird Price)
products.product_short_desc: Get your child to start their first coding adventure!

products.product_desc:
Launch your kid’s adventure into the digital world!

This is a coding course for new coders aged 6 – 8 (Yr. 1 – 3) Students should have experience using a laptop, keyboard and mouse.

Classes are held Tuesday – Friday 10am to 4pm during half term holiday and Monday – Thursday from 10am to 4pm during summer holidays.

Course Description

Our Junior Coders will be tackling three topics in their busy days – touch typing, coding and robotics.

We will teach the all important touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games, and competing in exciting challenges.

In our robotics sessions we will be exploring LEGO Wedo, building robotic LEGO models! LEGO Wedo helps build science, technology and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts.

Our third topic will focus on coding games, animations and interactive storytelling in the graphical programming language, Scratch. In Scratch we will learn basic coding concepts – such as sequencing and debugging.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you through Class Dojo and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

Computer literacy: using the keyboard and mouse with ease
Algorithms: concepts and application
Beginner Coding concepts: conditionals, debugging, sequences and loops
Robotics: using input and output devices

Pre-requisites
None! This is for beginners

Laptop Policy: For this class we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day! Early drop off is offered to everybody for the first day of camp (Monday).

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Book before 15th May for an Early Bird special price!

DifficultyBeginner - Intermediate
Age GroupAges 6-8
DateMay 30 - June 2, July 17 - 20, July 24 - 27 and July 21 - August 3
LocationColville Primary School, W11 2DF
TimesMonday - Thursday (10am to 4pm) (Tuesday - Friday during half term holiday)
Price£362.50 + VAT (Early Bird Price)
products.product_short_desc: Launch your kid’s adventure into the digital world!

products.product_desc:
Classes take place from 9.30am to 11.30am, with half an hour at the end for questions/discussion time, taking it to 12pm. 

Coding is an increasingly important skill to learn in our technology focussed world. While children are learning the fundamentals of coding and computational thinking in schools, clubs and holiday camps, parents might be feeling left behind! By the end of the course you will be better able to communicate with your child about Computing, security and e-safety.

blue{shift}’s ‘Coding for mums and dads‘ four week course intends to demystify coding, giving parents the tools they need to support their children as they complete their computing education under UK’s National Curriculum.

This course will cover the same concepts, tools and languages that we teach children in our After School Clubs and Holiday Camps. Our teacher will guide parents through core computing and coding concepts, teaching both block-based languages and text-based languages to create animations, games and web apps.

Syllabus

Session 1: Scratch and Introduction to Programming
Session 2: Intro to the web: programming in JavaScript with HTML and CSS
Session 3: Internet security, e-safety and hacking. We will even try some common security hacks ourselves!
Session 4: TBC

Come join us for what will be an enjoyable and enlightening course!

DifficultyBeginner
Age groupParents
DateFridays 16th June - 7th July 2017
LocationFarmacy, 74 Westbourne Grove, W2
Times9.30am - 11.30am
Price£245 / 4 sessions
